alluxio.master.journal

Class CheckpointManager

  • java.lang.Object
    • alluxio.master.journal.CheckpointManager

  • public final class CheckpointManager
extends Object
    A class which manages the checkpoint for a journal. The updateCheckpoint(String) method will update the journal's checkpoint file to a specified checkpoint, and recoverCheckpoint() will recover from any failures that may occur during updateCheckpoint(String). The checkpoint updating process goes 
     1. Write a new checkpoint named checkpoint.data.tmp
 2. Rename checkpoint.data to checkpoint.data.backup.tmp
 3. Rename checkpoint.data.backup.tmp to checkpoint.data.backup
 4. Rename checkpoint.data.tmp to checkpoint.data
 5. Delete completed logs
 6. Delete checkpoint.data.backup

    • Constructor Detail

      • CheckpointManager

        public CheckpointManager(UnderFileSystem ufs,
                         String checkpointPath,
                         JournalWriter writer)
        Creates a new instance of CheckpointManager.
        Parameters:
        ufs - the under file system holding the journal
        checkpointPath - the path to the checkpoint file
        writer - a journal writer which can be used to delete completed logs

    • Method Detail

      • recoverCheckpoint

        public void recoverCheckpoint()
        Recovers the checkpoint file in case the master crashed while updating it previously. After this method has completed, the checkpoint at mCheckpointPath plus any completed logs will fully represent the master's state, and there will be no files at mBackupCheckpointPath or mTempBackupCheckpointPath.

      • updateCheckpoint

        public void updateCheckpoint(String newCheckpointPath)
        Updates the checkpoint file to the checkpoint at the specified path. The update is done in such a way that recoverCheckpoint() will recover from any failures that occur during the update.
        Parameters:
        newCheckpointPath - the path to the new checkpoint file
